attributes.content:
Yemen (+ Pol Pot)

PHNOM PENH — War Nerd wilting in record heat/drought in Cambodia . . . Khmer Rouge genocide + museum . . . The war in Yemen: when it started (way, way back), who's fighting, and how badly it is going for the Saudis and their proxies . . . bring in the mercenaries! . . . 


Total time: 1:36:12


Direct link to this episode's mp3
attributes.title: Radio War Nerd, Episode #33—May 13, 2016

attributes.content:
Originally posted Apr 29, 2016

FSB, the Russian Deep State, Edward Snowden

Guest: Andrei Soldatov, investigative reporter in Moscow


Reposting for open public this great 90-minute interview with fearless Russian investigative reporter Andrei Soldatov on topics ranging from 2006 Lebanon War between Israel & Hezbollah, to rise of FSB Deep State under Putin, the strangulation of Russia's once-wild Internet space, and Edward Snowden's "strange" refusal to meet with Russian journalists . . . Post-interview, War Nerd discusses pustules and current events, reads some Radio War Nerd subscriber comments . . .


Total episode time: 2:28:54


Direct link to this episode's mp3
attributes.title: Radio War Nerd: Repost Episode #31 Open

attributes.content:
Urban guerrillas in 70s America


War Nerd in Phnom Penh . . . warning: audio this episode kinda buggy . . . War World Roundup: Ergodan consolidates power, Nagorno-Karabakh front still hot, Western human rights preachers still whoring for Baku oil cash . . . Muqtada al-Sadr's followers take over Green Zone by walking in . . . remembering neocons from NRO to Andrew Sullivan who dismissed Sadr as a nobody . . . Green Zone takeover as future of war . . . The incredible SS Columbia Eagle mutiny in 1970, when leftwing sailors hijacked ship full of US military napalm and forced it to Cambodia . . . US urban guerrillas in the early-mid 1970s, from Weather Underground to SLA, Black Liberation Army to the NWLF . . . 


Direct link to this episode's mp3.
attributes.title: Radio War Nerd, Episode #32—May 8, 2016

attributes.content:
Here's a 20-minute preview of our newest Radio War Nerd episode (total length 2:28:54) featuring an excellent 90-minute  interview with Russia's most fearless NatSec investigative reporter, Andrei Soldatov. Subscribe to Radio War Nerd to listen to the entire episode and all previous locked episodes. Depending on your pledge, you can also get our downloadable RSS feed for your podcast app, the Radio War Nerd Newsletter, Show Notes and more...

Join the Radio War Nerd Legion. Before it's too late...

attributes.content:
The Opium Wars


War Nerd stuck in Bangkok . . . Turkey's genocide-deniers take to NYC's skies . . . Azerbaijan president's insane tweets . . . Israel celebrates soldier who executed wounded Palestinian, reminds of US turning Lt Calley into a hero . . . Egypt sells 2 islands in Gulf of Aqaba to Saudi Arabia . . . The Opium Wars . . . 


Direct link to this episode's mp3
attributes.title: Radio War Nerd, Episode #30—April 24, 2016

attributes.content:
Nagorno-Karabakh War: Armenians vs Azerbaijanis (+ oilmoney)

Merkel prosecutes German satirist to please Ergodan . . . War Nerd heading to Cambodia . . . Assassinations from Lincoln to Operation Nemesis . . . Italian friend jailed in Turkey for having pro-Kurdish Facebook posts . . . CIA's "Plan B" to arm the legendary Syrian moderates . . . Russian Sukhois buzzing US destroyer in the Baltics, and gloating at Americans . . . Long history of the Nagorno-Karabakh conflict, Armenia & Azerbaijan . . .


Direct link to this show's mp3.
attributes.title: Radio War Nerd, Episode #29—April 15, 2016

attributes.content:
Getting To Know Islamic State Jihadis

Guest: Gunnar Hrafn Jonsson, Iceland Public Radio


Great interview with Icelandic journalist who has spent years now in Dark Web contact with numerous ISIS jihadis. Jonsson is also an early WikiLeaks collaborator who gives background to Iceland prime minister's resignation over Panama Papers leaks . . . 


Direct link to this episode's mp3.

attributes.content: Radio War Nerd covers the world of wars every week, and it's all thanks to our paying subscribers. Most of our shows are now locked for our subscribers only. So if you're looking for those missing shows, and you want your War Nerd fix on a regular weekly basis from here until the end of time, then subscribe now and join the War Nerd Legion!
attributes.title: Want To Hear Every War Nerd Episode? Subscribe Now!

attributes.content:
Palmyra + The War Nerd's history with Human Terrain System

Syrian government forces retake Palmyra from Islamic State . . . The ancient & glorious history of wars and battles in and around Palmyra . . . Why Palmyra matters, why IS took it, and why Palmyra fell . . . The US State Dept squeals . . . Human Terrain System program apparently not dead . . . The War Nerd's long personal history with the brains behind HTS, Mitzy Carlough . . . how interests of tenured academic sleaze aligns with right-wing reactionary power . . . painful memories . . . 


Direct link to this show's mp3
attributes.title: Radio War Nerd, Episode #27—March 31, 2016

attributes.one_liner: My name is John Dolan aka Gary Brecher aka The War Nerd
attributes.pay_per_name: Per Show (maximum 2 paid shows per month)
attributes.summary:
Radio War Nerd Update—

At the end of last summer, we started these Radio War Nerd podcasts. Since then, the response has been fantastic. It seems like we can keep this going and turn it into something with real strategic significance.

At first we did a show every two weeks, but we promised that if the donations came in we’d move to a weekly format. Well they did. And we’ve gone weekly now, along with special extra episodes such as when Turkey shot down the Russian Sukhoi, or our special interview with Guardian journalist Jason Walsh on the Oregon standoff.

Thanks to your support for Radio War Nerd, we can devote more attention and time to the one thing we all want to focus on—wars. With your help, we’re getting closer to the real goal—dropping all the dreary scary paycheck distractions, and devoting everything to bringing you the world of war.
We’re really just getting started sampling the rich vein of weird and gory in todays’ wars. We have lots of ideas and above all bringing in new voices from parts of the world not often heard on the air. To do that we’ll need to make a few technical upgrades and I’ll have to find a place to bunker up on a more permanent basis. This trudging around the world losing bits of baggage like a SAM-hit Boeing is no way to run a War Nerd Railroad (try saying that three times). Mark’s been holding the fort in NYC while I bounce around southern Europe, but we hope that very soon we’ll both be in permanent reliable Comms rooms, a mere ocean apart.

It’s exciting as hell and I just want to say I’m really grateful for the support. What with the ESL follies, my wife and I were beginning to get the impression that we were Top of the Interpol Pops or something, and it warms the old ticker to learn that there are people out there who want to hear from us.

Since we started these broadcasts, I have not been evicted from a single country. Keep the streak alive!
attributes.thanks_msg: Thank you so much for your support. I really appreciate it. The Radio War Nerd Legion is growing...

attributes.description: If you're kind enough to commit to $5 per show, I'll send you my biweekly Radio War Nerd subscriber newsletter into your email inbox. In it I discuss everything from wars past and present to my own personal wanderings through southern Europe.

If you're generous enough to commit to $10 per month, I'll send you my show notes plus a copy of my War Nerd Dispatches ebook containing all of my columns from NSFWCORP. Plus the biweekly subscriber newsletter.
If you're foolish enough to contribute $100 or more per show, you'll become an official "sponsor" of the show, complete with a name check in every episode including a link to the URL of your choice.
Thanks to our fantastic subscribers we reached our goal of $2500/show. This means we're starting weekly Radio War Nerd podcasts in December, every War Nerd Wednesday.
attributes.title: Produce new episodes weekly
